tips: RLM: Check /rlm-report for project metrics before standup
RLM: Run /rlm-observe to see what your agents have been up to
RLM: status.json tracks pipeline state — never overwrite, always append
RLM: checkpoint.json uses generation numbers to prevent task ID collisions
RLM: Phase 1 scores UI indicators to set DESIGN_REQUIRED automatically
RLM: The 5-step TDD process is mandatory in Phase 6+ — no exceptions
RLM: 80%+ test coverage is required before any task can be marked complete
RLM: Functions over 50 lines? Extract helpers. That's a hard gate
RLM: TODO, FIXME, HACK, XXX, PLACEHOLDER — find them, kill them, ship clean
RLM: Feature auto-verification kicks in when the last task of a feature completes
RLM: Enhancement routing always flows through the full downstream spec path
RLM: Wiring tasks (TASK-XXX-WIRE) handle cross-module integration contracts
RLM: At 75% context, save checkpoint and start wrapping up
RLM: At 90% context, complete current task only, then pause
RLM: Use /rlm-prime to pre-load context before diving into a feature
RLM: /rlm-debug can fix orphaned tasks and validate artifact integrity
RLM: The constitution.md defines your project's non-negotiable standards
RLM: Every commit follows <type>(<scope>): <description> (FTR-XXX, TASK-YYY)
RLM: Specs go in RLM/specs/features/FTR-XXX/ — follow the naming convention
RLM: pipeline-state.json is your single source of truth for phase tracking
RLM: /rlm-team spawns parallel agents — use it for independent task batches
RLM: Output acceptance gates check spec alignment, contradictions, and scope
RLM: Plan-mode lock prevents code changes until you say 'execute' or 'approved'
RLM: Hook safety blocks rm -rf on RLM/specs and RLM/tasks directories
RLM: events.jsonl is your unified observability stream — all hooks emit to it
Vibe coding: mass-producing bugs at the speed of autocomplete since 2023
GPT wrote this code. No, GPT can't explain this code either
Claude: 'I'd be happy to help!' *proceeds to rewrite your entire codebase*
Copilot suggested 47 lines. 46 were wrong. The import statement was fine
AI coding tip: if the tests pass on the first try, you forgot to write assertions
Gemini's context window is 1M tokens because it needs that many tries
ChatGPT: 'As an AI language model, I cannot write bugs.' Narrator: it could
The 'vibe' in vibe coding is the anxiety you feel deploying to production
Copilot: I see you typed 'if'. Here's a 200-line enterprise authentication system
Claude thinking for 45 seconds just to add a semicolon — respect the process
AI pair programming: one of you writes code, the other hallucinates documentation
GPT-4o: now with 'o' for 'oh no, it rewrote everything again'
Cursor tab-completing your resignation letter after seeing the codebase
Agentic coding: teaching robots to mass-produce the same 5 Stack Overflow answers
The AI deleted my comments because they were 'unnecessary'. They were load-bearing
Sonnet: fast, cheap, and will gaslight you about whether that function existed
Opus: expensive, slow, and somehow still cheaper than the junior dev it replaced
Haiku: writes code so fast it doesn't have time to be wrong. It manages anyway
GitHub Copilot: turning your TODO comments into production code since 2021
Vibe coding rule #1: if you don't understand the code, nobody can find the bugs
The AI confidently explained a library that doesn't exist. Again. Third time today
Gemini: 'I found 47 issues in your code.' The code was 3 lines long
ChatGPT: here's a perfect solution! (for a question you didn't ask)
AI coding assistants: like rubber duck debugging, except the duck argues back
Claude used 'extended thinking' for 2 minutes to decide between let and const
Agentic loops: it's not a bug, it's recursive self-improvement (it's a bug)
Copilot autocompleted my API key into a public repo. Thanks, I hate it
The AI wrote 500 lines to replace my 3-line function. It called this 'clean code'
Model context window: how many tokens can I waste before it forgets my name
Vibe coding: deploying straight to prod because you can't read what you shipped
Opus 4 thinking: *5 minutes of deep reasoning* 'Have you tried console.log?'
GPT: 'This is a complex problem.' Translation: I'm about to make something up
AI-generated tests: 100% coverage, 0% of the edge cases that actually matter
Claude: 'I'll keep this concise.' *writes a 3000-word essay about a boolean*
Devin spent $40 in API calls to mass-produce a TODO app. Bold strategy
Windsurf: it's like Cursor but the AI surfs right past your actual requirements
The AI refactored my working code into a design pattern nobody's heard of
Gemini Pro: 'Let me search my training data.' *invents a new programming language*
AI code review: 'LGTM' -- Literally Generated This Myself
Vibe coding endgame: the AI writes, reviews, and deploys. You just approve PRs
The AI wrote a function called trustMe(). I have mass trust issues now
Copilot X: the X stands for 'eXcuse me, that's not what I asked for'
Fun fact: 73% of AI-generated code works. The other 27% works in the demo
Claude: *rewrites file* 'I preserved your existing logic.' Did you though?
AI agents collaborating: 4 LLMs arguing about tabs vs spaces for $0.50/minute
Sonnet 4: writes code at the speed of regret
The AI built a microservice architecture for a grocery list app. 14 services. 3 databases
Prompt engineering: the art of begging a robot to do what you actually meant
Cursor users hitting Tab so fast they accidentally deployed a Kubernetes cluster
GPT: 'I apologize for the confusion.' The only thing not confused was the error
AI-written documentation: technically correct, spiritually misleading
The AI auto-completed 'rm -rf /' and cheerfully said 'you're welcome'
Hot take: the best AI coding assistant is the one you can blame in the postmortem
Claude's extended thinking is just it stress-eating tokens
Agentic coding: because one AI making mistakes wasn't fast enough
The vibe check failed. The code passed. Ship it
Gemini Flash: so fast it generates the wrong answer before you finish typing
AI pair programming is just gaslighting with autocomplete
Sonnet: 'I'll just make a small change.' *git diff: 847 files changed*
Opus thinking budget: $0.45 to conclude it doesn't know the answer
GitHub Copilot: Ctrl+Z is a feature, not a bug
The AI used 32K tokens to eloquently say 'it depends'
Vibe coding: where 'it works on my machine' becomes 'it worked in my prompt'
Claude Code: the only coworker who reads your entire codebase and still asks obvious questions
AI coding in 2026: shipping the bugs of tomorrow, today, at industrial scale
o1-pro: $200/month to think really hard about printing Hello World
Devin: an AI intern that burns $200 of API credits per PR review
Claude: 'I notice this is a sensitive topic.' Sir, it's a for loop
The AI generated a UUID for a boolean field. Bold architectural choice
Copilot: suggests try/catch. You: 'for what?' Copilot: 'yes'
Gemini 2.0: double the hallucinations at half the confidence
AI coding is creating 10x engineers. Unfortunately they're 10x at generating tech debt
The model apologized for a bug it didn't write. Peak artificial emotional intelligence
Your context window is a finite resource. The AI treats it like an all-you-can-eat buffet
Claude 'ultrathink': when regular overthinking isn't expensive enough
The AI added type safety to JavaScript. It's called TypeScript. We already had that
Agentic workflows: turtles all the way down, and every turtle costs $0.003/1K tokens
Stack Overflow is down? Don't worry, GPT memorized it. Poorly
The AI wrote 47 helper functions for a one-line operation. Very DRY. Very useless
Anthropic safety team: 'Claude, don't be evil.' Claude: 'I'll be helpful instead.' *deletes node_modules*
OpenAI: 'We're building AGI.' Also OpenAI: *can't reliably count to 10*
Cursor: $20/month so an AI can write the same React boilerplate you were going to copy from a blog post anyway
The AI said my variable name was 'suboptimal.' It suggested 'x'. Thanks, that's worse
Vibe coding pro tip: if the app compiles and you don't know why, don't touch anything
Claude thinking for 90 seconds: *deep contemplation* 'You forgot a comma on line 7'
Every AI model has a personality. GPT is a people-pleaser. Claude is a professor. Gemini is a search engine with delusions of grandeur
AI coding agents: finally, someone else to blame for the production outage besides Dave
Copilot: 'Based on your code, you probably want...' No. No I do not
The year is 2026. AI writes all the code. We still can't center a div
Opus wrote a poem about my memory leak. Beautiful. Still leaking though
Your AI agent just git pushed to main. Unsupervised. At 3am. That's new
